item.title: Dumped washing machine, 22nd October
item.description:
Dumped since this morning. Please could it be removed. Thank you.

item.title: 5 nitrous oxide canisters in total right and left hand grass verges in Elysian Avenue, 22nd October
item.description:
Repeated dumping of 5 nitrous oxide canisters on both sides of Elysian Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 182, Chislehurst Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burrage place, 22nd October
item.description:
The whole road (Burrage place) and pavement on both sides hasn’t been swept for months. Huge building waste bag dumped on the pavement, with extra rubbish added on everyday. Leaves, litter like : plastic bottles, food waste, glass all over the ground and it’s getting in to the street gulies and blocking them. Hazard to walk with little kids, elderly residents and pets. Very unpleasant to walk down this road to Burrage place bus stop or the pharmacy on the corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burrage Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near corner of Torbay Road and Dyne Road, 22nd October
item.description:
Part of a bike has been abandoned, attached to a public sign post. It has been there for well over a year.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement outside school covered in leaves and broken glass, 22nd October
item.description:
The pavement outside Monkfrith School on Brookside South is covered in leaves and acorns that are very dangerous. There is also smashed beer bottles amongst the leaves and a car tyre in the bush at the end of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knoll Drive, Brunswick Park, London

item.title: On Exeter Road, between the Jubilee Heights underground and overground carpark entrances, 22nd October
item.description:
Several green bags of what looks like garden waste (no option to say they were green in the multiple choice menu) have been on the street for several days. I reported this yesterday and received an email today that the issue was resolved. It is not as attached photo clearly shows. It is, inevitably, attracting further rubbish which I have been dealing with myself, but am getting frustrated!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scaffolding blocking entrance to our park, 22nd October
item.description:
Scaffolding in being illegally erected on one of our entrances to Bromley Palace Park. The pathway that runs along the park side of the St Blaise Building belongs to Bromley Palace Park, therefore people have no right to erect scaffolding and block our entry. Please can you deal with this as soon as possible as the path leads to our steps and down further into our park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
